description: From Middle English diuretyk, from Old French diuretique; ultimately from Ancient Greek διουρητικός (diourētikós). Surface analysis, diuresis +‎ -etic.

adjectives.description: diuretic (comparative more diuretic, superlative most diuretic)

entries.meaning: (medicine, pharmacology) Increasing the amount or frequency of urination.
(medicine, pharmacology) A drug or a substance that increases the rate of urine excretion.
